column5: Stopped at the large newly named "No-Frills" grocery at Geraldton 2 weeks ago for $150 or so worth of extra groceries. Getting to the check-out, was informed they longer take Visa. As Cabela's card is Visa, we will probably go back to picking up the extra needed stuff at Thunder Bay, like we used to a few years ago. The reason given was that Visa charges the firm more than Mastercharge, etc. Poor management decision, in my opinion, but maybe no big deal to "No-Frills". Bill

Interesting. "No Frills" is part of the largest grocery store chain in Canada. However, the No Frills stores might be franchised stores so they make their own rules? I don't know. I agree with you though, not accepting Visa because of fees is an antiquated decision for large businesses.edit: Looks like none of them accept Visa or AmEx. Didn't know that. They do have a bank as well and only offer Mastercard, so that probably has something to do with it as well.
No Frill's in Gananoque hasn't accepted Visa cards for the past 5 years I've been going there. They did accept accept Master Card though. Since I don't have a M/C, I started shopping at Metro.
Sams Club doesn't take Visa also. At least in the U.S. Not sure about Canada.
Sam's Club will take Visa debit, just not Visa credit. Their store brand card is also MC so it may have something to do with it, but I would guess it has to do with fees.
